Thanks for inviting me.  #tiechat
A4b: The price of NG favors fuel cell companies like Bloom Energy and ClearEdge Power that use NG as an input. Trucks may use NG. #tiechat
A4a: The price of oil makes EV potentially more interesting for businesses and consumers. Biofuels also become more attractive. #tiechat
A4: Cloud helps in being able to host and process large data sets to make better energy-related decisions. FirstFuel is example. #tiechat
A3a: I don't know if I agree. I see Sentilla doing great work with BMC and SAP, for example. #tiechat
Real time is one part, but now you can aggregate weather, building energy usage, building management systems, pricing too. #tiechat
A3b: It is a huge role. We see the next generation of innovation being driven by software analytics and all kinds of data. #tiechat
Fuel cell research is going forward, but there are no specific callouts for incentives to deploy. #tiechat
Thermal management across the whole battery pack is now important for batteries in EV design. Battery chemistry important too. #tiechat
A3: Big mrkt. Data center electricity consumption is large expense item. APPL just announced a new 20MW data center in N. Carolina #tiechat
Biofuel scaling will be highly dependent on continued high price of oil. If oil prices drop, it will be hard to scale production. #tiechat
Auto design requires some changes. The engine and power source are tightly connected to design. Battery mgmt now very key. #tiechat
A2b: Energy efficiency: it is much less capital intensive than energy deals in late 2000s. See interesting software-based deals. #tiechat
Biofuels is certainly getting lots of interest now. Low cost feedstock is a major driver to success. It may be possible. #tiechat
A3: The startups focused on commodities such as NG and oil production and sustainability are distributed across the US.  #tiechat
A2a: There is a revolution in transition from incandescent to LED lighting. Prices are dropping and new uses are being discovered. #tiechat
A2: Rising oil prices continue to make EV attractive. Seeing renewed interest in the sector: autos, batteries, power train. #tiechat
A1b: 2012 is transitional year for solar. Price drops are stabilizing. Industry has achieved peak grid parity in certain states. #tiechat
A1a: Unfortunate for them that the market timing was off. Would like to see a successful solar IPO to reinvigorate market. #tiechat
A1: Natural gas fracking makes gas-powered solutions (auto, plants) attractive. Electricity prices rising with coal decommissioning #tiechat
Sounds good. #tiechat
It is my pleasure to attend. Thanks for the invite. #tiechat
